API Model Selector for OData, using entity set names for the selection. MUST only be used if the API Resource provides an API Resource Definition of type edmx. Type: Object(type, entitySetName) Property Type Description type MANDATORY string The type for OData selectors is fixed to odata. Allowed Values: "odata" entitySetName MANDATORY string OData entity set name. As defined in the EDMX, e.g. <EntitySet Name="AttachmentContent">. Minimum Length: 1 Example Values: "AttachmentContent" Example Values:‚Äã { "type": "odata", "entitySetName": "AttachmentContent" }

Generic API Model Selector for JSON / YAML based resource definitions. It uses a JSON Pointer that points to the entity type description within the resource definition. The JSON Pointer always to refer to the structure of the document as originally provided, before further post-processing like resolving $ref properties. MUST only be used if the API Resource provides an API Resource Definition of media type application/json or text/yaml. Type: Object(type, jsonPointer) Property Type Description type MANDATORY string The type for generic JSON Pointer selectors is fixed to json-pointer. Allowed Values: "json-pointer" jsonPointer MANDATORY string JSON Pointer to the entity type schema / description within the resource definition format. MUST be a valid JSON Pointer according to RFC6901. The JSON pointers MUST point to each instance of the mapped entity type in the resource definition file, BEFORE $ref JSON Schema References are resolved (dereferenced). Minimum Length: 1 Example Values: "#/objects/schemas/<schema name>" "#/components/schemas/sap.odm.sales.CustomerOrder.Placed.v0" "#/objects/schemas/<schema name>/table-oriented/<table name>" Example Values:‚Äã { "type": "json-pointer", "jsonPointer": "#/objects/schemas/AttachmentContent" }

Define which entity type is the target of an entity type mapping Entity types can be referenced using a ORD ID of an entity type. Type: Object(ordId) Property Type Description ordId MANDATORY string The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy. It MUST be a valid ORD ID of the appropriate ORD type. Association Target: ordId) Regex Pattern: ^([a-z0-9]+(?:[.][a-z0-9]+)*):(entityType):([a-zA-Z0-9._\-]+):(v0|v[1-9][0-9]*)$ Maximum Length: 255 Example Values: "sap.odm:entityType:BusinessPartner:v1"

Define which entity type is the target of an entity type mapping Entity types can be referenced using a Correlation ID. Type: Object(correlationId) Property Type Description correlationId MANDATORY string Regex Pattern: ^([a-z0-9]+(?:[.][a-z0-9]+)*):([a-zA-Z0-9.\-\/]+):([a-zA-Z0-9.\-\/]+)$ Maximum Length: 255 Example Values: "sap.csnexposure:entity:Attachment"

Defines the relation between Entity Types (via its ORD ID). Type: Object(ordId, relationType) Property Type Description ordId MANDATORY string The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy. It MUST be a valid ORD ID of the appropriate ORD type. Association Target: ordId) Regex Pattern: ^([a-z0-9]+(?:[.][a-z0-9]+)*):(entityType):([a-zA-Z0-9._\-]+):(v0|v[1-9][0-9]*)$ Maximum Length: 255 Example Values: "sap.odm:entityType:BusinessPartner:v1" relationType OPTIONAL BETA string Optional type of the relationship, which defines a stricter semantic what the relationship implies. If not provided, the relationship type has no semantics, it's "related somehow". Allowed Values: "part-of": The described entity type is a composite part of the referenced entity type. E.g. a SalesOrderItem is part of a SalesOrder. "can-share-identity": The related entity types can potentially share the same identity in their instance data / be ID mapped. E.g. a BusinessPartner can share the same identity as a NaturalPerson. Introduced in Version: 1.12.0 Example Values: "can-share-identity"

Defines which Entity Type is exposed through (via its ORD ID). Type: Object(ordId) Property Type Description ordId MANDATORY string The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy. It MUST be a valid ORD ID of the appropriate ORD type. Association Target: ordId) Regex Pattern: ^([a-z0-9]+(?:[.][a-z0-9]+)*):(entityType):([a-zA-Z0-9._\-]+):(v0|v[1-9][0-9]*)$ Maximum Length: 255 Example Values: "sap.s4.sot:entityType:BusinessPartner:v1"

The ORD Document API is a plain REST API that is described via an OpenAPI 3.0 definition. The OpenAPI yaml file is published here: /spec-v1/interfaces/DocumentAPI.oas3.yaml It can also be viewed via Swagger UI.
